inputs.task: Design and improve the LaunchBase homepage from first principles
inputs.whitePaper:
LaunchBase is an operating system for small businesses.
Not a website builder. Not another tool. Not a one-time agency project.

LaunchBase is ongoing ownership of a business's digital operating layer:
- website uptime + maintenance
- lead capture + forms
- monitoring + safety decisions
- updates + publishing cadence
- integrations + visibility
- logging + accountability

LaunchBase exists because most small businesses already have tools, but no one owns the system.
They have a website, a payment tool, a calendar, a Google profile, and logins…
…but the owner still carries the burden of making sure everything works.

LaunchBase sells relief from that cognitive load.

Core customer pain: The customer isn't buying a website. They're buying the ability to stop thinking about:
- "Is it still working?"
- "Did that form actually send?"
- "What should I post?"
- "Is anything broken?"
- "Am I missing something?"

This is background anxiety, not a feature gap.
The enemy is not "lack of tools."
The enemy is lack of ownership.

LaunchBase replaces the customer as the default system-checker.

Promise:
✅ Change is reversible
✅ Non-action is safe
✅ Silence is a valid decision
✅ Every action is logged
✅ Customer sees their real site before paying
✅ LaunchBase acts only after approval

The brand is accountability.
LaunchBase is responsibility-as-a-service.

Target customer:
- owner-operator
- service business
- small team
- not "tech obsessed"
- wants a business to run, not to "manage tools"

Tone: calm, competent, honest, operationally serious, safety-first, premium but not flashy.
This is a systems product, not a "creative brand party."

Design objective:
✅ Create instant trust
✅ Communicate the contract clearly
✅ Show the "safe-by-default" nature
✅ Make "Hand It Off" feel low-risk
✅ Explain observability in plain English
✅ Look premium enough to justify recurring ownership

currentCopy.hero: Stop carrying the system in your head. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
currentCopy.problem: No one owns the system. You're the fallback for everything.
currentCopy.solution: LaunchBase becomes the owner. You stay informed, not involved.
currentCopy.trust: Safe by default. Fully logged. Reversible.

inputs.audience: Owner-operators of service businesses (fitness studios, coffee shops, consulting firms) who want stability and accountability, not tool management
inputs.tone: Calm, minimal, trustworthy, premium. Avoid hype. Avoid 'AI magic.' Avoid exaggerated claims.
inputs.constraints: Mobile-first. Must feel like 'responsibility-as-a-service.' Must emphasize safety, reversibility, observability. Must reduce mental load while reading.

proposedChanges.value: Introduce a split-screen hero layout with a short video loop on the left demonstrating the dashboard, and the current hero text on the right.
proposedChanges.rationale: This will engage users visually and provide immediate context for the 'hand it off' concept.
risks: Video may slow down load times

proposedChanges.value: Reorder to have the 'Trust' section immediately after the hero to strengthen the initial trust-building.
proposedChanges.rationale: Positioning trust messaging early can help alleviate customer anxiety about handing off control.
risks: May delay understanding of specific problem/solution benefits

proposedChanges.value: Convert pricing tables to cards with one highlighted default tier; add 'what you get' bullets under each price.
proposedChanges.rationale: Card layout with highlighted tier simplifies comparison and highlights recommended options.
risks: Users may miss detailed pricing information if not expanded

proposedChanges.value: Ensure primary CTA button is large and prominent; use a contrasting accent color for the button.
proposedChanges.rationale: Clear, prominent CTAs improve conversion rates by providing a clear action path.
risks: Overemphasis could detract from content readability

proposedChanges.value: Add sticky primary CTA on mobile after 40% scroll; keep secondary CTA in hero only.
proposedChanges.rationale: Ensures that the CTA is always accessible, improving conversion opportunities on mobile.
risks: Sticky elements may obstruct view on smaller screens

proposedChanges.value: Include an interactive audit log preview showing how actions are logged and reversible.
proposedChanges.rationale: Demonstrates accountability and transparency, reinforcing trust.
risks: Interactive elements may increase load time

proposedChanges.value: Add a proof bar with logos of trusted partners or testimonials below the hero.
proposedChanges.rationale: Social proof can increase trust and credibility quickly.
risks: May be perceived as clutter if not well integrated

proposedChanges.value: Increase section gap to 48px for better readability and separation on mobile.
proposedChanges.rationale: Improves readability by creating visual breaks between sections.
risks: Increased scrolling may affect user patience

proposedChanges.value: Merge 'Problem' and 'Solution' into one section with a before/after two-column layout.
proposedChanges.rationale: Streamlines information delivery, reducing cognitive load and enhancing scannability.
risks: May oversimplify complex aspects

proposedChanges.value: Increase font size to 3rem and use bold weight for stronger emphasis on the hero message.
proposedChanges.rationale: Enhances the visual hierarchy and draws attention to the primary message.
risks: May cause text overflow on smaller screens

proposedChanges.value: Use 48px H1 (mobile: 32px) with line-height 1.2 for hero headline to create calm, confident tone
proposedChanges.rationale: A larger, consistent headline size with a generous line-height conveys confidence and calmness.
risks: May require adjustments to other type sizes for consistency

proposedChanges.value: Adopt a card style with 8px radius, light shadow, and 24px padding to maintain a premium feel with readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Soft corners and light shadows enhance the premium feel while maintaining approachability.
risks: May affect visual consistency with existing design elements

proposedChanges.value: Use pill-shaped buttons with 16px padding, subtle shadow, no gradients for a modern, approachable look
proposedChanges.rationale: Pill-shaped buttons with subtle shadows help create an inviting, modern interface.
risks: May require additional design adjustments to existing button styles

proposedChanges.value: Set universal radius to 8px for consistency across components
proposedChanges.rationale: A consistent radius across components creates a unified design language.
risks: Potential adjustments needed for existing components with different radii

proposedChanges.value: Add 3-chip row below hero: 'Safe by default • Fully auditable • Reversible changes'
proposedChanges.rationale: Chips quickly communicate key trust elements in an easily digestible format.
risks: Chips may need to be visually distinct to ensure they are noticed

proposedChanges.value: Use a consistent log style with timestamp, action type, and status icon to enhance readability and trust
proposedChanges.rationale: Consistent log styles improve readability and convey a sense of reliability and accountability.
risks: Complex logs may require additional design adjustments for clarity

proposedChanges.value: Use a calm blue (#4A90E2) as primary color to convey trust and reliability
proposedChanges.rationale: A calm blue tone is traditionally associated with trust and stability.
risks: May require a review of color contrast for accessibility

proposedChanges.value: Apply subtle shadows (e.g., 1px 1px 5px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)) to key components for depth without overwhelming
proposedChanges.rationale: Subtle shadows add depth and enhance the premium feel without distracting from content.
risks: Shadows may appear differently across various displays

proposedChanges.value: Set max text width to 65ch for body copy to improve readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Limiting line length improves readability and reduces cognitive load.
risks: May require reevaluation of layout for mobile devices

proposedChanges.value: Use soft gradients or subtle textures as background treatments to add depth without distraction
proposedChanges.rationale: Soft gradients and textures can enhance the visual appeal without overwhelming the user.
risks: May require careful color balancing to maintain text readability

swarm.reason: Missing craft or critic artifact for collapse
